com.ibm.gaiandb.apps.sensordemo

Class GraphLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.gaiandb.apps.sensordemo.GraphLoader

  • public class GraphLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Loads the graphs, either from a default set or from a custom properties file.
    Author:
    Samir Talwar - stalwar@uk.ibm.com

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraphLoader

        public GraphLoader(java.sql.Connection conn,
                   java.util.Properties customProperties)
        Initialises the graph loader.
        Parameters:
        conn - The database connection to query for graph data.
        customProperties - Any custom settings or graphs.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public java.lang.String get(java.lang.String name)

      • load

        public DatabaseDiagram[] load()
        If the custom property is set to on, this loads the graphs specified in the properties list. Otherwise, it loads a default set of graphs.
        Returns:
        An array of graphs.

      • loadDefault

        public DatabaseDiagram[] loadDefault()

        Loads a default set of graphs and a legend for use with the sensor monitor demo.

        Graphs:

        • CPU Usage
        • Disk I/O
        • Battery Power
        • Used Memory
        • Network I/O
        • Temperature
        • Acceleration
        Returns:
        An array of graphs.

      • loadCustom

        public DatabaseDiagram[] loadCustom()
        Loads custom graphs using the properties provided.
        Returns:
        The custom graphs that were loaded successfully in an array.

      • createLegend

        public ChartLegend createLegend()
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a graph legend using the node names.
        Returns:
        A legend.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the SQL used could not be prepared correctly.

      • createLegend

        public ChartLegend createLegend(java.lang.String sql)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a graph legend using the SQL provided.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL to use to retrieve the legend data.
        Returns:
        A legend.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the SQL provided could not be prepared correctly.
